intro: Campanopsis roxburghii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Campanopsis roxburghii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
